intro: Heptapleurum versteegii, commonly known as the African nettle, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Urticaceae. It is native to tropical Africa and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically wind-pollinated. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Heptapleurum versteegii is known for its stinging hairs, which can cause skin irritation upon contact.
